GeneralInformation.School Vision: A premier school which provides quality holistic education to every BBSSian.
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To nurture BBSSians to be self-directed learners with abundance mentality.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: We believe every child is unique and has innate abilities to be developed.  Our school values - RESPECT (Reflection, Enterprise, Self-discipline, Perseverance, Empathy, Creativity, Teamwork), mission and vision, represent our collective passion, dreams and aspirations, and guide us in how we work with our parents, community and partners to realise the full potential of our students.  We endeavour to build a culture of care, self-directedness and compassion amongst staff and students.  At BBSS, children are firmly at the heart of our work and we seek to develop the whole child by providing meaningful and connected learning experiences that will allow every BBSSian to develop the right values, competencies and skills to do well in the 21st century.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.STEM: Developing Proactive Problem-Solvers who care for our World through STEM
School Distinctive Programmes.Community & Youth Leadership: Developing Community Youth Leadership through Values-in-Action

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: As our foundational programme, we adopted Arthur L. Costa's the Habits of Mind (HOM) to inculcate in BBSSians good learning habits and thinking dispositions so that they can become self-directed, life-long learners.  BBSSians systematically learn the 16 habits through hands-on experiences and then practise these habits daily.  Our LLP is the Community Youth Leadership Programme which aims to nurture RESPECTful Leaders who are confident and self-directed in serving the community with abundance mentality. This programme encompasses the twin pillars of Leadership Development and Values-In-Action (VIA) and provides BBSSians with leadership training experiences like Outward Bound courses and overseas expeditions and opportunities to organise school-wide events like Project Mi and Project Heartwork.  Our ALP is in the area of embedded electronics.  It builds upon the fundamentals of Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) and aims to develop BBSSians as proactive problem-solvers who care for the world.  This programme focuses on application of sensing technologies in our everyday life.
